A representative sample size was estimated at 95 % confidence level and below 1 % error commitment, as shown below (Chand et al. 2012):
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$n = \frac{{NZ^{2} P(1 - P)}}{{N \cdot e + Z^{2} P(1 - P)}}$$\end{document}

where n = is the sample size, N = is the population size, Z = Confidence level at 95 %, Z = 1.96, P = Estimated population proportion (0.5), e = is the precision level (0.003).
